issue.title: [Website] Update arrow-site/README and any other places to point website contributors in right direction
issue.body:
***Note**: This issue was originally created as [ARROW-6225](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-6225). Please see the [migration documentation](https://gist.github.com/toddfarmer/12aa88361532d21902818a6044fda4c3) for further details.*

### Original Issue Description:
I noticed this is out of date

https://github.com/apache/arrow-site/blob/asf-site/README.md

We might want to ask ASF Infra to make the "master" branch the default when people land at apache/arrow-site on GitHub

comments.body:
***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-6225?focusedCommentId=16906338) by Neal Richardson (npr):*
On <https://github.com/apache/arrow-site/pull/9>, README.md gets deleted by the build script. There's no point of serving arrow.apache.org/README.md. Is that a satisfactory resolution?

Is ASF Infra required to change the default branch? Or is a committer or PMC authorized to go to the repository settings?

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-6225?focusedCommentId=16906339) by Wes McKinney (wesm):*
Yeah Infra would have to change the default branch

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-6225?focusedCommentId=16906342) by Neal Richardson (npr):*
I can make an Infra ticket–is that the way to go?

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-6225?focusedCommentId=16912130) by Kouhei Sutou (kou):*
Could you create an issue to INFRA project to change the default branch?
